page.title: 13TRANSPORT IN SANDBACH
page.content: {TRANSPORT}IN SANDBACH WILL HAVE TAKEN ON A NEW LOOK BY THE END OF NEXT YEAR. IN THE SPRING OF 1985 WORK BEGAN ON A NEW ROAD TO{BY-PASS}SANDBACH CENTRE FOR ALL TRAFFIC TRAVELLING TO AND FROM THE M6{MOTORWAY.}THE ROAD PASSES BEHIND THE CONGLETON ROAD ESTATE, TOUCHING THE DINGLE AND THE PALMER ROAD ESTATE BEFORE JOINING CREWE ROAD 100 YARDS FROM THE TOWN CENTRE.THE CENTRE IS SMALL AND IS ON THE MAIN ROAD LINKING SUCH TOWNS AS CREWE AND MIDDLEWICH TO THE M6.THE ROADS ARE NARROW AND THERE IS A COMPLEX SYSTEM OF TRAFFIC LIGHTS,ROUNDABOUTS AND ISLANDS.{CONGESTION}BUILDS UP EASILY ESPECIALLY WHEN THE WEATHER IS BAD.IN HIGH TOWN THE HEAVY LORRIES OFTEN HAVE TO MOUNT THE PAVEMENT WHICH CAUSES DAMAGE TO THE ROAD SURFACE,THE KERB,THE BUILDINGS AND DANGER TO THE PEDESTRIANS.
